data.title: Shows A-Z - brickleberry on comedy central
data.text:
view all related dvds | view all related news | view all related listings

[07/08/20 - 09:22 AM]

Hulu Unveils Outrageous & Beloved Nominees for the First Ever Adult Animation "HAHA Awards"

Hulu subscribers and non-subscribers can cast votes for their favorites in all categories on the official awards website or via social poll on Hulu's Twitter channel through Sunday, July 19.

[04/04/18 - 10:36 AM]

Netflix Announces "Paradise P.D.," A New Adult Animated Comedy Series from the Creators of "Brickleberry"

Dana Snyder, Cedric Yarbrough, Dave Herman, Tom Kenny, Sarah Chalke and Kyle Kinane are among the voice cast.

[01/07/15 - 02:35 PM]

Comedy Central Cancels "Brickleberry" After Three Seasons

The show's most recent run averaged a series low 882,000 viewers.

[08/20/14 - 12:01 PM]

"Brickleberry" Season 3 Premieres September 16 at 10:30 pm ET/PT; "Adam Devine's House Party" Season 2 Premieres September 9 at 10:30 pm ET/PT

The latter will then move into its permanent timeslot on Thursday, September 11 at 12:30 a.m. ET/PT.

[08/04/14 - 08:37 AM]

Comedy Central Sets Fall 2014 Schedule Featuring "South Park," "Tosh.0," "Key & Peele" and More

Other premieres include "Gabriel Iglesias Presents Stand-Up Revolution," "Brickleberry" and "Adam Devine's House Party."

[07/21/14 - 12:38 PM]

Zap! Pow! Bang! Comedy Central(R) Hits San Diego Comic-Con with Multiple Fan Events

Said offering start with back-to-back panels as Comedy Central Presents "Key & Peele" and Introduces "Moonbeam City" on Thursday, July 24.

[06/03/14 - 11:47 AM]

Comedy Central's Hits Head to Bonnaroo

Highlights include the "Drunk History Live with Derek Waters and Friends" show will take place at Bonnaroo Cinema on Saturday, June 14 at 3:45 p.m.

[04/15/14 - 11:25 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, April 15

Updates include: TV Land gives cast-contingent pilot order to "Impastor"; Jake Busey cast in History's "Texas Rising"; and Michael Fresco inks pilot deal with ABC.

[11/01/13 - 07:36 AM]

November Marks the Return of All-Time Comedy Great Bill Cosby for His First All-New Concert Special in 30 Years "Bill Cosby: Far From Finished" Saturday, November 23, at 8:00 P.M. ET/PT

Also on tap this month from Comedy Central: original stand-up special "Steve Rannazzisi: Manchild" on Saturday, November 16.

[10/30/13 - 12:32 PM]

Comedy Central(R) Renews "Key & Peele," "Brickleberry" and "Drunk History"

All three new seasons will premiere in 2014.

[08/27/13 - 09:30 AM]

Jon Stewart Returns to "The Daily Show" on Tuesday, September 3 at 11:00 P.M. ET/PT

The intrepid host took a sabbatical in June from the series in order to direct his first feature film, entitled "Rosewater."

[08/22/13 - 11:19 AM]

Daniel Is Back with New Episodes of "Tosh.0" Premiering on Comedy Central(R) Tuesday, September 3 at 10:00 P.M. ET/PT

Currently in its fifth season, the new episodes will lead into the second season of "Brickleberry."

[08/19/13 - 11:22 PM]

Development Update: Monday, August 19

Updates include: Sarah Clarke joins AMC's "Line of Sight"; NickMom extends "Instant Mom" by seven episodes; and Demi Lovato near deal for six-episode arc on FOX's "Glee."

[08/14/13 - 10:30 AM]

Pack Your Bags and Pitch Your Tent! The Second Season of "Brickleberry" Premieres on Comedy Central(R) Tuesday, September 3 at 10:30 P.M.

The 13 new episodes will follow the fall premiere of "Tosh.0."

[07/09/13 - 02:06 PM]

Comedy Central Is Coming to San Diego Comic-Con 2013

"Workaholics," "South Park," "Brickleberry" and "Futurama" are among the featured panels.

[06/12/13 - 11:27 AM]

Twentieth Century Fox Television to Dominate Comic-Con 2013 with Eleven Drama, Comedy and Animation Panels

On tap are newcomers "Sleepy Hollow" and "Murder Police" as well as first appearance of "How I Met Your Mother" at the annual event.

[01/23/13 - 07:17 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Promotes Kent Alterman to President, Content Development & Original Programming

He was formerly Head of Original Programming and Production, responsible for the development and day-to-day operations of all original programming on the linear channel.

[11/13/12 - 10:46 AM]

Comedy Central to Air Stand-Up Specials from Gary Gulman, Eugene Mirman in December

"In This Economy" and "An Evening of Comedy in a Fake Underground Laboratory" premiere on Saturday, December 8 and Friday, December 21, respectively.

[11/09/12 - 09:08 AM]

Comedy Central Renews Hit Animated Series "Brickleberry" for a Second Season

The 13-episode second season is scheduled to premiere in Fall 2013.

[10/09/12 - 12:08 PM]

It's Indecision Time as "The Daily Show with Jon Stewart" and "The Colbert Report" Bring Live Election Night Coverage on Tuesday, November 6 at 11:00 P.M. ET

Plus: look for "Chris Hardwick: Mandroid," "Kyle Kinane: Whiskey Icarus" and "Russell Peters: The Green Card Tour" next month.

[09/21/12 - 07:28 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Unveils Multiplatform Marketing Campaign for the Launch of ITs New Animated Series "Brickleberry"

Said campaign will feature exclusive content on Facebook, Tumblr and Decksi.

[09/12/12 - 10:29 AM]

Fluffy and Friends Are Back with a Second Season of "Gabriel Iglesias Presents Stand-Up Revolution" Debuting on Thursday, October 4 at 10:00 P.M. ET/PT on Comedy Central

Also due next month: "Mash Up," "a unique new half-hour stand-up series," hosted by T.J. Miller.

[08/22/12 - 08:58 AM]

Comedy Central's(R) Fall Season Kicks Into High Gear!

"Tosh.0," "Brickleberry," "South Park" and "Key & Peele" all roll out the week of September 25.

[08/21/12 - 07:30 AM]

Welcome to the Wilderness! New Animated Series "Brickleberry" Premieres on Tuesday, September 25 at 10:30 P.M.

As previously announced, the Daniel Tosh-led series will follow the fall run of "Tosh.0."

[08/15/12 - 09:31 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Sets Fall Schedule Featuring All-New Series and Specials As Well As Returning Favorites

Newly announced premieres include the return of "South Park" and "Key & Peele" on Wednesday, September 26.

[07/03/12 - 08:00 AM]

Comedy Central(R) to Present "Workaholics," "Brickleberry" and "Futurama" Panels and a "Workaholics" Happy Hour Event at the Hard Rock Hotel at Comic-Con(R) International 2012 in San Diego

The cable channel details its plans for this year's event.

[06/13/12 - 07:33 AM]

"Glee" Cast and Creators Return to Comic-Con 2012 in Star-Studded Panel Saturday, July 14

Also on tap from 20th are "Bones," "Bob's Burgers," "Brickleberry," "Futurama," "The Simpsons," "Family Guy," "American Dad," "The Cleveland Show" and "Sons of Anarchy."

[06/08/12 - 11:19 PM]

Development Update: Friday, June 8

Updates include: Joshua Malina in, Henry Ian Cusick out on ABC's "Scandal"; Cinemax's "Strike Back" to return Friday, August 17; and "NCIS" locks in Rocky Carroll for season 10.

[05/29/12 - 11:06 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, May 29

Updates include: "Private Practice" drops co-star Tim Daly; Comedy Central's "Brickleberry" to premiere Tuesday, September 25; and "Game of Thrones" producers detail season three roles.

[12/07/11 - 09:09 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Announces 2011-2012 Development Slate

Wyatt Cenac, Andrew Daly, Rob Delaney, Anthony Jeselnik, Jeff Ross, Amy Schumer, Russell Simmons and JB Smoove are among the featured auspices.

[08/15/11 - 08:01 AM]

Comedy Central(R) Greenlights "Brickleberry" Animated Series, a Co-Production of Fox 21 and Comedy Central, From Executive Producers Daniel Tosh, Waco O'Guin and Roger Black

"Daniel Tosh pointed a gun at our heads and asked if we would put this series on the air, and we agreed that would be a good idea," said Kent Alterman.
